integrations.html.title: Integrations
integrations.html.body:
Integrations

react-revalidateValidate React component props with revalidate validation functions.

redux-revalidateValidate your Redux store state with revalidate validation functions.

Redux FormCreate validation functions for your form components out of the box.Example

Immutable.jsBuilt-in support for Immutable.js via a separate module import.Example

usage/.title: Usage
usage/.body:
Usage
Revalidate provides functions for creating validation functions as well as
composing and combining them. Think redux
for validation functions.

common-validators/.title: Common Validators
common-validators/.body:
Common Validators
Revalidate exports some common validations for your convenience. If you need
something more complex, then you'll need to create your own validators with
createValidator.

isRequired
isRequiredIf
isAlphabetic
isAlphaNumeric
isNumeric
hasLengthBetween
hasLengthGreaterThan
hasLengthLessThan
isOneOf
matchesPattern
matchesField

common-validators/isRequired.html.title: isRequired
common-validators/isRequired.html.body:
isRequired
isRequired is pretty self explanatory. It determines that a value isn't valid
if it's null, undefined or the empty string ''.
import { isRequired } from 'revalidate';

isRequired('My Field')();     // 'My Field is required'
isRequired('My Field')(null); // 'My Field is required'
isRequired('My Field')('');   // 'My Field is required'
isRequired('My Field')('42'); // undefined, therefore assume valid

common-validators/isRequiredIf.html.title: isRequiredIf

common-validators/isAlphabetic.html.title: isAlphabetic

common-validators/matchesPattern.html.title: matchesPattern
common-validators/matchesPattern.html.body:
matchesPattern
matchesPattern is a general purpose validator for validating values against
arbitrary regex patterns.
import { matchesPattern } from 'revalidate';

const isAlphabetic = matchesPattern(/^[A-Za-z]+$/)('Username');

isAlphabetic('abc'); // undefined, so valid
isAlphabetic('123'); // 'Username must match pattern /^[A-Za-z]+$/'

Note: matchesPattern does not require a value, so falsy values will pass.
isAlphabetic();      // undefined because not required, so valid
isAlphabetic(null);  // undefined because not required, so valid
isAlphabetic('');    // undefined because not required, so valid

common-validators/matchesField.html.title: matchesField

test-helpers/.title: Test Helpers
test-helpers/.body:
Test Helpers
Revalidate includes some test helpers to make testing your validation functions
easier. You can import the helpers from revalidate/assertions. All helpers
return booleans.

hasError
hasErrorAt
hasErrorOnlyAt

test-helpers/hasError.html.title: hasError

test-helpers/hasErrorAt.html.title: hasErrorAt

test-helpers/hasErrorOnlyAt.html.title: hasErrorOnlyAt
